destinations.name: Maasai Mara National Reserve
destinations.description: World's greatest wildlife spectacle during the Great Migration. Experience the Big Five in their natural habitat with expert local guides.
destinations.fullDescription:
The Maasai Mara National Reserve is one of Africa's most magnificent game reserves. Bordering Tanzania, the Mara is the northern extension of the Serengeti and forms a wildlife corridor between the two countries. It's named after the statuesque, red-cloaked Maasai people who live in the park and graze their animals as they have done for centuries. The park is famous for the Great Migration, when thousands of wildebeest, zebra, and Thomson's gazelle travel to and from the Serengeti, from July through October.

The Mara has one of the highest lion densities in world, and is home to all the Big Five (lion, leopard, elephant, buffalo, and rhino). Other wildlife includes cheetah, zebra, giraffe, hyena, crocodile, hippo, and various antelopes. Over 450 bird species have been identified in the park.
destinations.bestTimeToVisit: July to October during the Great Migration, January to February for fewer crowds

destinations.name: Diani Beach, Mombasa
destinations.description: Pristine white sand beaches with crystal clear waters. Perfect for diving, snorkeling, and experiencing Swahili coastal culture.
destinations.fullDescription:
Diani Beach is a flawless paradise stretching 17 kilometers along Kenya's south coast. This award-winning beach boasts powder-white sand, lush greenery, and the warm, turquoise waters of the Indian Ocean. Coral reefs close to shore create perfect conditions for snorkeling and diving, with colorful marine life just a short swim away.

Beyond the beach, visitors can explore the Shimba Hills National Reserve, take boat trips to spot dolphins, or visit the sacred Kaya forests. The area maintains strong Swahili cultural influences, with local markets, cuisine, and architecture reflecting these traditions. The vibrant nightlife, water sports, and luxury beachfront accommodations make Diani a versatile destination for relaxation and adventure.
destinations.bestTimeToVisit: January to March and July to October for dry weather and calm seas

destinations.name: Amboseli National Park
destinations.description: Iconic views of Mount Kilimanjaro with large elephant herds. Famous for incredible wildlife photography opportunities and Maasai cultural encounters.
destinations.fullDescription:
Amboseli National Park offers one of Africa's most classic and breathtaking views: herds of elephants strolling across the plains with the snow-capped Mount Kilimanjaro in the background. Despite its relatively small size (392 sq km), Amboseli has varied landscapes including the dried-up bed of Lake Amboseli, wetlands with sulphur springs, savannah, and woodlands.

The park is famous for being the best place in Africa to get close to free-ranging elephants. Other wildlife includes lions, cheetahs, giraffes, impalas, elands, waterbucks, gazelles, and more than 600 species of birds. The park also offers cultural encounters with the Maasai people, whose villages border the park.
destinations.bestTimeToVisit: June to October and January to February for clear views of Kilimanjaro

destinations.name: Adventure Awaits
destinations.description: From hiking mountains to exploring rift valleys, Kenya offers thrilling adventures for everyone.
destinations.fullDescription:
Kenya is a paradise for adventure seekers, offering a diverse range of adrenaline-pumping activities across its varied landscapes. From climbing Mount Kenya, Africa's second highest peak, to white-water rafting on the Tana River, the country presents limitless opportunities for outdoor enthusiasts.

Hike through the dramatic landscapes of Hell's Gate National Park, where towering cliffs, deep gorges, and geothermal features create a surreal backdrop for rock climbing and mountain biking. Trek through the ancient forests of the Aberdare Mountains or challenge yourself with the multi-day hike up Mount Kenya.

For water enthusiasts, Kenya offers everything from kitesurfing on the Indian Ocean to kayaking on Lake Naivasha. Wildlife adventures include walking safaris, camel trekking in the northern frontier, and even running with Kenyan marathon champions in the highlands.
destinations.bestTimeToVisit: January to March and June to September for dry conditions

accommodations.name: Adventure Camps Kenya

accommodations.description: Comfortable base for mountain expeditions

destinations.name: Vibrant City Life
destinations.description: Explore the bustling cities of Kenya, rich in culture, history, and modern attractions.
destinations.fullDescription:
Kenya's urban centers offer a fascinating blend of African traditions, colonial history, and contemporary energy. Nairobi, the vibrant capital, is a cosmopolitan hub where skyscrapers tower over national parks, and where you can enjoy world-class dining before spotting rhinos at the nearby Nairobi National Park.

Mombasa, with its rich Swahili heritage, features the historic Fort Jesus, bustling markets, and a vibrant nightlife along its coastal setting. Kisumu, on the shores of Lake Victoria, provides insights into Luo culture while offering modern amenities and lakeside attractions.

In these cities, visitors can explore museums that chronicle Kenya's diverse heritage, sample innovative fusion cuisine at trendy restaurants, browse contemporary art galleries showcasing East African talent, and experience the legendary Kenyan nightlife with its blend of traditional and modern music scenes.
destinations.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, with June to September offering pleasant weather
thingsToBring: City map or offline map app

destinations.name: Authentic Kenyan Cuisine
destinations.description: Indulge in the unique and diverse flavors of Kenyan food, from street food to fine dining.
destinations.fullDescription:
Kenyan cuisine is a delicious exploration of flavors influenced by indigenous traditions, Arab trade, Indian migration, and European colonization. The result is a vibrant culinary landscape that varies across different regions and cultures within the country.

Signature dishes include Nyama Choma (grilled meat, typically goat or beef), served with Ugali (maize meal) and Sukuma Wiki (collard greens). Along the coast, Swahili dishes like Pilau (spiced rice), Biryani, and fresh seafood dominate, showcasing the Arab and Indian influences. Traditional delicacies include Irio (mashed peas and potatoes with corn), Mutura (Kenyan sausage), and Githeri (beans and corn stew).

From bustling street food markets to upscale restaurants reinventing traditional dishes with modern techniques, Kenya offers culinary experiences for every palate. Don't miss trying Kenyan coffee and tea, grown in the highlands and considered among the best in the world.

accommodations.description: Boutique hotel with award-winning restaurant

accommodations.name: Tamarind Dhow
accommodations.description: Floating restaurant with accommodation options

accommodations.description: Renowned restaurant with boutique rooms

destinations.name: Mount Kenya
destinations.description: Africa's second highest peak with diverse ecosystems and trekking routes.
destinations.fullDescription: Mount Kenya is a magnificent stratovolcano that rises majestically from the central highlands of Kenya. As Africa's second-highest peak at 5,199 meters, it offers some of the most spectacular mountain climbing and trekking experiences on the continent. The mountain features diverse ecosystems ranging from montane forest to alpine desert, and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
destinations.bestTimeToVisit: January-February and July-October for dry weather

destinations.name: Lake Nakuru National Park
destinations.description: Famous for flamingos, rhinos, and diverse bird species.
destinations.fullDescription: Lake Nakuru National Park is renowned for its spectacular flamingo populations and as a rhino sanctuary. The alkaline lake attracts millions of flamingos, creating one of nature's most beautiful spectacles. The park is also home to both black and white rhinos, making it one of the best places in Kenya to see these magnificent creatures.

destinations.name: Kenya's Wildlife
destinations.description: Home to the 'Big Five' and countless other species.
destinations.fullDescription: Kenya's wildlife is legendary, offering some of the best game viewing experiences in Africa. The country is home to the famous 'Big Five' - lion, leopard, elephant, buffalo, and rhino - as well as countless other species including cheetahs, giraffes, zebras, and over 1,000 bird species.

destinations.name: Karura Forest
destinations.description: An urban forest in Nairobi with waterfalls, caves, and cycling trails.
destinations.fullDescription: Karura Forest is a 1,041-hectare urban forest reserve in Nairobi, offering a peaceful escape from city life. The forest features beautiful waterfalls, mysterious caves, and well-maintained trails for walking, jogging, and cycling. It's a perfect destination for nature lovers seeking tranquility within the bustling capital.
destinations.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, early morning for best experience

destinations.name: Unique Tree Houses
destinations.description: Experience Kenya from a unique perspective in a luxury tree house.
destinations.fullDescription: Kenya's luxury tree house accommodations offer an extraordinary way to experience the African wilderness. Built high among the trees, these unique lodges provide incredible views of wildlife and landscapes while offering modern comforts and exceptional service.

destinations.name: Classic Safari Experience
destinations.description: Embark on an adventure in a traditional open-roof safari vehicle.
destinations.fullDescription: The classic safari experience in Kenya involves exploring the wilderness in traditional open-roof safari vehicles. This authentic way of game viewing allows for unobstructed photography and an immersive connection with nature while maintaining safety and comfort.

destinations.name: Lamu Island
destinations.description: Step back in time in this UNESCO World Heritage site with rich Swahili culture.
destinations.fullDescription: Lamu Island is one of Kenya's most precious cultural treasures and a UNESCO World Heritage site. The island's Old Town is the oldest and best-preserved Swahili settlement in East Africa, with traditional architecture featuring intricately carved wooden doors and coral stone buildings. With no cars on the island, transportation is by foot, donkey, or traditional dhow sailing boats.
destinations.bestTimeToVisit: January to March and July to October for pleasant weather

accommodations.name: The Majlis Resort
accommodations.description: Luxury beachfront villa-style accommodation

accommodations.name: Lamu House Hotel
accommodations.description: Authentic Swahili-style boutique hotel

accommodations.description: Affordable authentic guesthouse

destinations.name: Hell's Gate National Park
destinations.description: Walk or cycle among wildlife in a dramatic landscape of cliffs and gorges.
destinations.fullDescription: Hell's Gate National Park is unique among Kenya's wildlife parks as it allows walking, cycling, and rock climbing. Named for the intense geothermal activity within its boundaries, the park features impressive rock formations, deep gorges, geysers, and hot springs. The landscape inspired settings in Disney's 'The Lion King' and was the location for the movie 'Tomb Raider: The Cradle of Life.'
destinations.bestTimeToVisit: January to March and June to October for dry conditions

accommodations.name: Lake Naivasha Sopa Resort

accommodations.name: Enashipai Resort & Spa
accommodations.description: Upscale resort with spa facilities

accommodations.name: Camp Carnelley's
accommodations.description: Rustic camping and budget accommodation

destinations.name: Lake Naivasha
destinations.description: Freshwater lake with hippos, over 400 bird species, and boat safaris.
destinations.fullDescription: Lake Naivasha is a beautiful freshwater lake in Kenya's Great Rift Valley, surrounded by mountains and known for its abundant birdlife and hippo populations. The lake supports a thriving flower industry and offers various activities from boat safaris to hiking on nearby Mount Longonot and Hell's Gate National Park.
destinations.bestTimeToVisit: January to March and June to October for pleasant weather

accommodations.name: Sawela Lodge
accommodations.description: Luxury lodge with lake views and manicured gardens

accommodations.name: Lake Naivasha Country Club
accommodations.description: Historic colonial-era property on the lake shore

accommodations.name: Fish Eagle Inn
accommodations.description: Mid-range accommodation with lake access

destinations.name: Nairobi National Park
destinations.description: The world's only capital city national park, with wildlife against city skyline views.
destinations.fullDescription: Nairobi National Park offers the remarkable experience of viewing wildlife against the backdrop of a capital city's skyline. Just 7 km from Nairobi's center, this unique park hosts lions, rhinos, giraffes, zebras, and over 400 bird species. Despite its relatively small size and urban location, the park provides authentic safari experiences with a diverse ecosystem.
destinations.bestTimeToVisit: July to March for best wildlife viewing

accommodations.name: Nairobi Tented Camp
accommodations.description: Only accommodation inside the national park

accommodations.name: Ole-Sereni Hotel
accommodations.description: Hotel overlooking the park boundary

accommodations.name: Emakoko Lodge
accommodations.description: Luxury lodge on the park's border

destinations.name: Samburu National Reserve
destinations.description: Semi-arid reserve home to unique species like the Grevy's zebra and reticulated giraffe.
destinations.fullDescription: Samburu National Reserve showcases a different side of Kenya with its rugged, semi-arid landscapes and unique wildlife. The reserve is home to the 'Samburu Special Five': Grevy's zebra, reticulated giraffe, Somali ostrich, gerenuk, and beisa oryx. The Ewaso Nyiro River running through the reserve creates a green belt that attracts animals and provides excellent viewing opportunities.
destinations.bestTimeToVisit: June to October and December to March for dry season

accommodations.name: Elephant Bedroom Camp
accommodations.description: Luxury tented camp on the Ewaso Nyiro riverbank

accommodations.name: Samburu Sopa Lodge
accommodations.description: Family-friendly lodge with traditional design

accommodations.name: Samburu Simba Lodge
accommodations.description: Mid-range lodge with river views

destinations.name: Cultural Experiences
destinations.description: Immerse yourself in Kenya's diverse cultures from Maasai to Swahili traditions.
destinations.fullDescription: Kenya is home to over 40 different ethnic groups, each with their own language and cultural traditions. From the iconic Maasai warriors with their vibrant red shukas and jumping dances to the Swahili communities along the coast with their blend of African and Arabic influences, Kenya offers rich cultural experiences for travelers seeking authentic interactions.
thingsToBring: Camera (always ask permission before photographing people)
Open mind and respect for local customs

accommodations.name: Maji Moto Eco Camp
accommodations.description: Community-run Maasai camp with authentic experiences

accommodations.name: Bomas of Kenya Homestay
accommodations.description: Cultural immersion program with local families

accommodations.name: Swahili House
accommodations.description: Traditional coastal home in Lamu

destinations.name: Chyulu Hills
destinations.description: Young volcanic mountains with stunning landscapes and excellent hiking.
destinations.fullDescription: The Chyulu Hills are one of the world's youngest mountain ranges, formed between 150,000 and 1.4 million years ago. This stunning landscape of rolling green hills and volcanic cones sits between Amboseli and Tsavo West National Parks. The area inspired Ernest Hemingway's 'Green Hills of Africa' and offers breathtaking views of Mount Kilimanjaro on clear days.
destinations.bestTimeToVisit: June to October and January to February for clear weather
